title: Alright Riot you took out a lot of the iconic memes in the game already
body: No more Brutalizer that costs 1337 gold.  No more Wit's End doing 42 on hit magic damage.  So can we at least make ignite do a measly 10 more damage at level 18 for a total of 420?  It would literally be 420 Blaze It.

replies.body: They made Trinity combine cost 333g once again.. there is at least that.
Use to just be 3

Three 3's are trinity-ier than 1 three. 

Cmon bro. Use Logic.
Then what if the combine cost was 3^3^3 3s?

So you'd want the combine cost to be 7625597480000 3s? (Just over 7 and a half Trillion)


Yeah no one could ever buy triforce :P

1337 is "LEET"
42 is a reference to "a hitchhikers guide to the galaxy"

but what is 420 a reference to? or is it just an extra zero on 42?

420 blaze it {{summoner:14}}

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/420_(cannabis_culture)
Ok, not gonna lie. I thought that said 420 was made for the consumption of cannibals. Talk about righting fire with fire.
"Cannabis Culture"

it's the police call number used in marijuana seizures in suspected homes. people took to using it as protest to smoke anyway and then the internet ruined a kind of tragically beautiful thing as they do quite often.

"tragically beautiful"

That's one way to put it...
what can I say? I'm a poet at kidney.
#420BLAZEITYOLO360NOSCOPE
You forgot to add HARAMBE to the end of it
it isnt the police call number, it's from a high school in cali

this ^^
Glad to know I was right!!!! but then again I'm from cali so.....
yeah that one. I'm not sure the specific jargon.
neither thespecific jargon nor the non specific jargon use 420 unless its an individual officer coining his own slang
Why did so many people downvote this? The guy is asking a question lol

ok so i googled it

apparently it does relate to smoking pot...

not all of us are drug addicts...

Glad you figured out. There is controversy over where the association comes from. I always thought it was Bob Marley's birthday or the day he died or something related to that, but I don't know. i just thought it was weird you were getting downvoted for asking a question. It's not like you can agree or disagree with a question XD
How do you know the first 2 but not 420? Wat?

BUT THIS WILL THROW OFF THE ENTIRE BALANCE OF THE GAME. DO YOU EVEN REALIZE HOW OVERPOWERED THIS WILL MAKE CERTAIN CHAMPS??? RIGHT NOW EVERYTHING IS PERFECTLY BALANCED, ESPECIALLY YASUO, IF WE DO THIS IT MIGHT MAKE HIM UNDERWHELMING SOMEHOW!!!

-every balance team member at Rito, apparently...

There are a few tips that people already know about facing a Yasuo; poke his shield off with autos, he's weakest right after his tornado is gone, and he's weak to ganks. I'd like to go into more detail.

The key to beating a Yasuo in lane is proper minion management, and proper management is different depending on whether you're a ranged or melee champion. As a ranged champion, you want to keep the wave in 1 of 2 places depending on Yasuo's health relative to yours. If Yasuo is ahead or even, you want to keep the wave frozen a bit outside of your own tower, so that he has to go into tower range to order to hit you. You can basically do whatever you want to him if the wave is in this spot because you can simply retreat into tower range if he tries to go onto you. However, if you're ahead of him in health, you want to start a slow push, so you can poke him whenever he tries to CS and you'll have a buffer of minion support if he tries to all in you. In this case, he can't do much either.

For a melee champion, you want to slow push pretty much all the time. Yasuo is extremely vulnerable to being all inned by melee champions when he's trying to CS, and a good Yasuo will try to do a slow push of his own to discourage his opponent from attacking him. One important thing to understand is that while enemy minions are oftentimes Yasuo's best friends since he uses them to dash, they are also one of his biggest weaknesses since he's required to tank them in order to trade. If you can bait him into tanking a lot of minions with some kind of defensive ability like an ori shield, you can very easily come out ahead in trades, provided you don't panic, keep autoing, and hit some extra free damage on him when he tries to get out.

Generally speaking, a Yasuo will always want the wave in 1 of 2 places. He either wants a slight minion advantage on his side so he can get free opportunities to poke with Q, but not so many more minions that the wave gets frozen outside the enemy tower. A good Yasuo will bait you into hitting minions with AOE abilities to push the wave back towards him if it starts to get too close to tower, allowing him to be aggressive again. The other position is for when Yasuo has a lead on his opponent; he will want to freeze outside of his tower, leaving a long trail of minions to dash through so he can all in you if you try to walk up to CS. The key to beating Yasuo is to keep the wave where you want it to be rather than the way he wants it to be, or there's not a whole lot you can do as a lot of champions.

Other general tips for beating Yasuo include: Ask for ganks, an aggressive Yasuo player is very easy to bait and kill if he isn't strong enough to 1v2 already. Take exhaust as a combat summoner if your kill pressure on him is low, itâ€™s a great way to neutralize his aggression in lane as well as neuter him in teamfights. If Yasuo misses his tornado, that is the time to be aggressive. His Q is on CD, he has no CC for a while, and his ult, by extension, is unavailable. And if Yasuo gets too aggressive in lane and messes up when trying to trade, all in him right then and there. If you get a lead against Yasuo, most champions will be able to zone him out heavily since he's a squishy melee only champion with no escape and no natural sustain.
